title: Massive cloudburst in J&K: 12 bodies recovered; Machail Mata Yatra suspended
content: A devastating cloudburst in Chosoti village, Kishtwar district, has resulted in the feared death of at least 12 people, leading to the suspension of the Machail Mata Yatra. Rescue operations are underway, with authorities mobilizing resources and teams dispatched to the affected area. Officials are assessing the damage and providing aid, while expressing condolences for the tragic loss of life.

title: Rattled by Op Sindoor, Pakistan hastily props up new missile force
content: Following Operation Sindoor, Pakistan is bolstering its military by establishing the Army Rocket Force Command to oversee its missile arsenal. Equipped with modern technology, this force aims to enhance conventional war capabilities. Amidst rising tensions and increased military spending, Pakistan also plans to acquire new fighter jets and air defense systems, while acknowledging support from friendly nations.

title: Rift in SP? MLA Pooja Pal expelled for praising CM Yogi Adityanath
content: The Samajwadi Party expelled MLA Pooja Pal for anti-party activities after she praised Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath. Pal thanked Adityanath for delivering justice in her husband's murder case by eliminating criminals like Atiq Ahmed through policies like zero tolerance.

title: 'Shami spends lakhs on mistress' kids': Hasin calls pacer 'womaniser'
content: Hasin Jahan, Mohammed Shami's estranged wife, has publicly accused the cricketer of neglecting their daughter Ayra's education while allegedly prioritizing the schooling of his girlfriend's children. Jahan claims Shami spends lavishly on his girlfriend and her children, including business class flights and elite school admissions, despite receiving Rs 4 lakh monthly alimony, with Rs 2.5 lakh specifically for Ayra's expenses.

title: Apple CEO to employees: AI ‘as big or bigger’ than the internet; warns not using it will ...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook has declared AI as a pivotal opportunity, urging employees to integrate it into their work. Despite entering the AI race later than competitors, Apple aims to redefine the category, similar to its approach with PCs and smartphones. The company is investing heavily in AI, hiring 12,000 new employees and developing specialized chips and infrastructure.

title: Deep ocean mission: Indian aquanauts make record 5,000-metre dive
content: India has achieved a significant milestone with its aquanauts successfully reaching depths exceeding 5,000 metres in the North Atlantic, marking progress in the Deep Ocean Mission. This follows closely after an Indian astronaut's visit to the International Space Station.

title: How AI is forcing this big change in way Google, Cisco, McKinsey hire techies
content: Facing rising concerns about AI-driven cheating in online interviews, major companies like Google, Cisco, and McKinsey are reintroducing in-person interviews. Recruiters report a surge in candidates misusing AI, from automating applications to employing deepfakes. This has led to a significant increase in firms requesting face-to-face meetings, up from 5% to 30% this year.

title: Electoral rolls show duplicate entries; EC probes LJP MP Veena Devi & husband
content: The Election Commission of India has issued notices to MP Veena Devi and her husband, MLC Dinesh Prasad Singh, following allegations of dual voter registration. Tejashwi Yadav publicly accused them of possessing multiple voter ID cards and being listed in different assembly constituencies. The ECI has initiated a formal inquiry, seeking responses from the couple by August 16, 2025.

title: AC duct treasure: 316 whisky bottles seized after passenger reported cooling issues
content: As Bihar gears up for elections, liquor smuggling intensifies. On the Lucknow-Barauni Express, authorities discovered 316 whisky bottles hidden in an AC duct after a passenger reported cooling issues. A coach attendant from Bihar, Ashish Kumar, was arrested; he confessed to smuggling liquor regularly from Uttar Pradesh to sell in Bihar's black market, exploiting prohibition laws.

title: 'Made huge contribution to cricket': Ratnakar recalls Vece Paes’ role in BCCI
content: Dr. Vece Paes, Olympian and father of Leander Paes, passed away at 80, leaving behind a legacy of contributions to Indian sports. He significantly impacted the BCCI by heading age verification and anti-doping departments, introducing the TW3 method to combat age fraud and launching educational programs featuring cricket icons.

title: Audi employees in Germany to the company: Cannot build a factory in America without ...
content: Audi's plan to establish a U.S. plant faces hurdles as labor leaders prioritize securing German jobs amidst President Trump's tariffs. The labor official, Jörg Schlagbauer, insists on long-term guarantees for German production before supporting U.S. expansion. Trump's tariffs, impacting European carmakers, prompt Audi to consider U.S.

title: Delhi rain: Man dies, daughter injured as massive tree falls on vehicles in Kalkaji
content: In Kalkaji, South Delhi, a neem tree collapsed due to heavy rains on Thursday morning, critically injuring two individuals. Sudhir Kumar, 50, and his daughter Priya, 22, were riding a motorcycle when the tree fell on them. They were promptly rescued and taken to Safdarjung Trauma Centre.

title: 'Ask your paw paw ...': Cong mocks BJP's Sonia voter row; 'good photoshop'
content: Congress refuted BJP's claims regarding Sonia Gandhi's voter registration. They alleged BJP used manipulated documents. Trinamool Congress MP accused Amit Malviya of forgery. BJP had alleged Sonia Gandhi enrolled as a voter twice without proper citizenship. They questioned the timing of her Indian citizenship acquisition. The parties exchanged accusations on social media platform X.

title: Junagadh horror: Dalit man beaten, abused for ‘sporting moustache & beard’
content: In a Junagadh village, a Dalit man, Sagar Makwana, was allegedly assaulted and subjected to casteist slurs by upper-caste individuals for sporting a moustache and beard. The attack, which also severely injured Makwana's father-in-law, occurred after a confrontation escalated over Makwana's appearance. Police have registered a case and are actively pursuing the accused, who face charges under the Atrocities Act.

title: 75+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for 2025
content: India will celebrate Independence Day on August 15, 2025. The day honors freedom fighters' sacrifices. People share wishes with family and friends. Messages reflect freedom and national pride. Celebrations include patriotic songs and flag hoisting. Citizens pledge to protect unity. The day promotes love for the nation. It encourages remembering the past and dreaming of tomorrow. Jai Hind

title: Amidst Trump's tariff war, S&P upgrades India's credit rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-'
content: S&P Global has upgraded India's credit rating to 'BBB' with a stable outlook, a significant boost despite potential US tariffs. S&P anticipates that the Trump administration's tariffs, including those on crude oil trade with Russia, will not significantly impact India's economic growth.

title: IKEA India opens store in Delhi: 15,000 sq ft outlet at Pacific Mall
content: IKEA India has inaugurated its first Delhi store in Pacific Mall, Tagore Garden, marking its fourth city presence after Hyderabad, Mumbai, and Bengaluru. The 15,000 sq ft outlet features over 2,000 home furnishing products, blending physical accessibility with online convenience. This launch is a significant milestone in IKEA's India expansion, aiming to bring affordable Scandinavian design closer to Delhi residents.

title: Watch: BMW sedan gets stranded on waterlogged Delhi road; traffic snarls
content: Heavy rain hit Delhi and surrounding areas. A BMW was stranded due to waterlogging in APS Colony. The downpour caused traffic disruptions across the city. The India Meteorological Department issued an orange alert. Several areas recorded significant rainfall. Ring Road and other key roads faced traffic jams. Commuters experienced inconvenience due to the weather. More rain is expected.

title: Stray dogs case: SC blames 'inaction' of authorities; 10 takeaways from hearing
content: The Supreme Court has reserved its order on a plea to stay its earlier directive regarding stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, expressing strong disapproval of local authorities' inaction. The court heard arguments highlighting the severity of dog bite incidents and the need for a resolution, while also considering concerns about the removal of stray dogs from the streets and the lack of adequate shelter facilities.

title: Palghar poll list glitch: Voter’s name appears 6 times
content: The discovery of a Palghar woman's name appearing six times on electoral rolls has triggered an investigation ordered by collector Indu Jakhar to rectify the discrepancy. This duplication, highlighted on social media, prompted the Chief Electoral Officer to seek a detailed report and immediate resolution.

title: US wants deeper Pak ties: Trump admin eyes minerals, hydrocarbons
content: Amid stalled trade talks with India, the US government aims to strengthen economic ties with Pakistan, focusing on critical minerals and hydrocarbons. Secretary of State Rubio highlighted the ongoing partnership, while Trump has in the past spoken of potential collaboration on Pakistan's oil reserves.

title: Renukaswamy murder case: SC cancels actor Darshan's bail; orders his immediate arrest
content: The Supreme Court overturned the Karnataka High Court's decision, cancelling the bail of Kannada actor Darshan Thoogudeepa, his girlfriend Pavithra Gowda, and five others implicated in the Renukaswamy murder case. Darshan was arrested with 16 others for allegedly abducting, torturing, and murdering Renukaswamy, a 33-year-old fan.

title: ITR filing FY24-25: Don’t make mistake of not reporting tax exempt incomes like PPF
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: Taxpayers must report exempt income, such as PPF interest and life insurance proceeds, in their ITR to ensure transparency and avoid future scrutiny. Disclosing these incomes, even though tax-free, helps explain the source of funds, especially for large receipts. Failure to report may lead to notices for information mismatch and potential delays in refund processing.

title: Trump’s tariff fallout? India-China trade talks on horizon; critical rare earths, & pharma in focus
content: India and China are set to discuss a trade package focusing on essential commodities like rare earth magnets, fertilizers, and pharmaceuticals, coinciding with PM Modi's SCO summit attendance. This move signals improving relations amid US trade tensions and India's need for Chinese imports.

title: 'My plus one...': Arjun's fiancée’s adorable pictures with Sara Tendulkar – IN PICS
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandhok, granddaughter of Mumbai entrepreneur Ravi Ghai. The intimate ceremony was attended by close family and friends. Sister Sara Tendulkar shared heartwarming photos with her future sister-in-law, expressing her joy. Saaniya is an entrepreneur and animal welfare advocate, founding Mr. PAWS, a pet care brand.

title: Spotted! Sachin Tendulkar with his future daughter-in-law Saaniya Chandok
content: Sachin Tendulkar and his family, including future daughter-in-law Saaniya Chandok, were recently photographed performing a pooja at home. Saaniya, engaged to Arjun Tendulkar, is the granddaughter of businessman Ravi Ghai and a director at Mr. Paws Pet Spa & Store LLP. The intimate gathering highlights the growing bond between the Tendulkar and Ghai families, offering a glimpse into pre-wedding celebrations.

title: Maharashtra meat ban row escalates: More civic bodies join
content: Several Maharashtra civic bodies, including Nashik, Jalgaon, and Kolhapur, have ordered slaughterhouses and meat shops to close on August 15, sparking controversy. Chief Minister Fadnavis stated the government isn't involved, citing a 1988 resolution allowing corporations to decide. Deputy CM Ajit Pawar expressed discomfort, while the BJP pointed out the policy originated under Sharad Pawar's leadership.

title: Cricket's Rs 1,400cr question: Should India play Pakistan in the Asia Cup?
content: Pakistan’s latest meltdown against West Indies is another instance of their struggles across formats. The Asia Cup in UAE which could see them clash vs India thrice, provided both qualify for final, was meant to trigger hype and boost the broadcasters’ revenue. However, with Pakistan’s form and record vs India being so poor, one wonders how enthused cricket fans will be about what was a marquee match not too long ago

title: Woman gang-raped at Delhi party: Drink spiked, victim beaten, filmed
content: In Delhi, a 24-year-old woman reported being drugged and gang-raped at a Civil Lines party. She accused a group of people, including a woman, of the assault and filming it, threatening to release the footage if she spoke out.

title: J&K statehood case: SC says can't ignore incidents like Pahalgam; seeks Centre's response
content: The Supreme Court emphasized the need to consider the ground reality in Jammu and Kashmir, citing incidents like Pahalgam, before restoring its statehood. The Centre has been asked to respond within eight weeks to a plea seeking immediate restoration.

title: '1 person 1 vote exists since 1951': EC slams Rahul's use of term 'vote chori'
content: The Election Commission has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" allegations, deeming them an attack on Indian voters and election staff. Gandhi claimed widespread vote theft in Karnataka, citing duplicate entries and fake addresses. The ECI challenged Gandhi to provide evidence, but Gandhi insists the data is from the Election Commission itself, daring them to deny its accuracy.

title: 'Vocal minority vs silent majority': Larger SC bench hears stray dogs case
content: The Supreme Court addressed the escalating stray dog issue, criticizing civic authorities for neglecting existing regulations. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta highlighted the severity of dog bite incidents and rabies deaths, emphasizing the need for a solution balancing animal welfare and public safety. Senior advocates argued against the order to catch stray dogs, questioning the availability of shelter homes and sterilization efforts, as the court reserves its decision.

title: PAK vs WI |Shoaib Akhtar - Babar aur Rizwan kab match winners banenge? ’
content: Following Pakistan's defeat against West Indies, Shoaib Akhtar criticized Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan for failing to be match-winners. West Indies defeated Pakistan by 202 runs, clinching the ODI series 2-1 after Jayden Seales's six-wicket haul dismantled Pakistan's batting lineup. Akhtar emphasized the need for Babar Azam to accelerate his scoring after reaching fifty, converting good starts into match-winning performances.

title: Asia Cup | 'Itni buri tarah maarenge na woh' - Ex-Pak cricketer hopes India don't play Pakistan
content: Following a shocking ODI series defeat against West Indies, former Pakistan cricketer Basit Ali has voiced concerns about the team's prospects in the upcoming Asia Cup. Ali fears a heavy loss against India and suggests that a defeat to Afghanistan would be less impactful than losing to their arch-rivals.

title: Varanasi horror: Man kills lover’s son after boy sees them together
content: In Varanasi, a man named Faizan was arrested for murdering his lover's 10-year-old son, who he saw as an obstacle to their relationship. While being taken to recover the body, Faizan attempted to escape by snatching a policeman's pistol. During the ensuing exchange of fire, he was shot in the leg and is now hospitalized under police custody.

title: Joy Taylor breaks silence; FOX Sports firing, lawsuit in focus; speaks on ‘Hot Mics’
content: Joy Taylor, recently fired from Fox Sports' 'Speak,' addresses her departure amidst an ongoing lawsuit. While denying any connection between the suit and her termination, Taylor acknowledges the significant changes at FS1. The lawsuit, filed by Noushin Faraji, alleges sexual misconduct involving Taylor, Charlie Dixon, and Emmanuel Acho, with Taylor refuting the claims.

title: Independence Day: Topic ideas for Aug 15 speech- tips to prep for school assembly
content: This Independence Day 2025 speech guide for students helps craft impactful school assembly addresses. It blends history, patriotism and current issues, offering ten engaging August 15 topics — from unsung freedom fighters to India 2047 — to inspire peers, promote critical thinking and make Independence Day celebrations more meaningful and memorable.

title: 'Secondary tariffs could go up …': US warns of higher sanctions on India
content: The Trump administration is threatening India with higher tariffs if upcoming US-Russia talks in Alaska fail, potentially increasing the existing 50% tariffs on Indian exports. These secondary tariffs, particularly the 25% levy on crude oil trade with Russia, are aimed at pressuring Putin to resolve the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: Telangana lashed by heavy rain: Schools shut as downpour continues for 24 hours
content: Telangana has been experiencing heavy rainfall for the past few days, with several districts receiving over 10 cm of rain in the last 24 hours. Maddukuri in Bhadradri Kothagudem and Jadcherla in Mahabubnagar recorded the highest rainfall. Due to the heavy downpour, schools in Suryapet and Khammam have declared a holiday for students.

title: DMK neta’s wife refuses to collect PhD from governor RN Ravi
content: During Manonmaniam Sundaranar University's convocation, a PhD scholar, Jean Joseph, protested Governor R.N. Ravi's presence by refusing to accept her degree from him, citing his opposition to Tamil Nadu's welfare. She instead posed with the vice-chancellor, expressing her support for the Dravidian governance model. BJP leader K. Annamalai criticized her actions as a politically motivated stunt by the DMK.

title: Mega-tsunami warning: 1k-ft waves to hit US Pacific Coast? Scientist raises alarm
content: A Virginia Tech study warns of a potential mega-tsunami along the US Pacific Coast, triggered by a major earthquake in the Cascadia Subduction Zone. Coastal regions face sudden land subsidence and massive waves, posing unprecedented risks to millions. Researchers urge immediate action for improved early-warning systems and resilient infrastructure to minimize potential devastation.

title: Dr. Vece Paes, Olympic bronze medallist, passes away at age 80
content: Dr. Vece Paes, an Olympic hockey bronze medalist from the 1972 Munich Games and a pioneer in sports medicine, passed away at 80. Beyond his hockey achievements, he excelled in cricket, football, and rugby, later leading the Indian Rugby Football Union. Dr.

title: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accuses PM Modi of bias in approving semicon projects to States
content: Losing a project to Andhra Pradesh comes as a rude shock for Telangana as latter State had laid the ground by sanctioning land and incentives

title: Partition Horrors Remembrance Day observed by ABVP in Kerala college, leads to clashes with SFI
content: ABVP observes the day by putting up posters about it at a government college in Kasaragod, following which SFI activists turn up in bigger numbers to oppose it. SFI burns effigy of Governor Rajendra Arlekar

title: Death of woman in Kothamangalam: SIT likely to arraign parents of the accused
content: As per a suicide note allegedly written by the 23-year-old woman,  Rameez, through his family, forced her for religious conversion as a precondition for marrying her

title: BMTC introduces electric Vayu Vajra buses to Bengaluru airport
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy flagged off the electric buses at the Bengaluru airport on August 14

title: Art historian Naman Ahuja on the repatriation of the Piprahwa Buddha relics
content: Unearthed in 1897, the relics are among the most significant archaeological discoveries in Buddhist history

title: Assam CM Himanta launches portal for arms licence application for indigenous people
content: Mr. Sarma said the aim of the initiative is to enable responsible citizens to aid and assist the government in maintaining peace, and law and order situation in the State

title: CBSE schools in Bengaluru welcome open book exams, stress on teacher training
content: The board announced that open book exams can be administered to class 9 students as part of internal assessment from 2026 - 27

title: Five Indian-Americans charged in Nebraska human trafficking case
content: The accused — Kentakumar “Ken” Chaudhari (36), Rashmi Ajit “Falguni” Samani (42), Amit Prahladbhai “Amit” Chaudhari (32), Amit Babubhai “Matt” Chaudhari (33), and Maheshkumar “Mahesh” Chaudhari (38) — allegedly owned and managed hotels where minors and adults were exploited for sex and forced labour

title: BBA(DBE) students of IIM Bangalore selected for fully-funded international immersion at Hiroshima University in Japan
content: BBA(DBE) aims to prepare future-ready entrepreneurs through an industry-relevant, modular, and fully online learning model. The programme attracted over 1,000 students from 359 cities nationwide in its first year

title: Cloudburst in J&K's Kishtwar, 10 feared dead
content: The annual yatra to the Machail Mata shrine has been suspended following the incident as authorities mobilised all resources and are heading to the scene to conduct a massive rescue and relief operation, officials said

title: Njattyela Sreedharan, self-taught linguist and creator of four-language Dravidian dictionary, passes away at 87
content: Sreedharan was celebrated for compiling Chathur Dravida Bhasha Padhaparichayam, a work hailed as a milestone in the study of South Indian languages

title: ‘Completely vague’: Supreme Court on plea to ‘return’ captive elephants kept in Vantara
content: “You are making allegations against parties which are not represented here. You have not made them respondents. You implead them and then come back to us we will see,” the Bench said

title: 16 BSF personnel get gallantry medals for Operation Sindoor
content: Among the medal winners are a deputy commandant rank officer, two assistant commandants and an inspector

title: T.N. Cabinet approves free breakfast, medical treatment, other aid for conservancy workers in urban local bodies
content: ‘Govt.’s doors always open for talks’; Minister Thangam Thennarasu appeals to workers to return to duty

title: Indian nurse on death row in Yemen: Supreme Court told negotiations going on, no immediate threat
content: The counsel for petitioner organisation Save Nimisha Priya International Action Council, which is extending legal support to Priya, requested a Bench of Justices Vikram Nath and Sandeep Mehta to adjourn the matter

title: Supreme Court reserves order on plea challenging removal of stray dogs from streets of Delhi NCR
content: The Supreme Court pulled up civic authorities over their failure to sterilise stray dogs but declined to stay its August 11, 2025, order directing their removal to shelters

title: Spat between producers Sandra Thomas, Vijay Babu escalates on social media hours before KFPA polls
content: Vijay Babu posts on Facebook that the pet dog he adopted since he dissolved the partnership with Sandra Thomas was more trustworthy. Soon, she responds remarking that ‘Vijay Babu can trust the dog. I am concerned about the dog trusting Vijay Babu’

title: Police station on Chennai waterbody: Madras High Court seeks original master plan from CMDA
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan order that the master plan related to Semmenchery police station in Shozhinganallur must be submitted next week

title: PIL on ‘detention’ of Bengali-speaking migrant workers: Supreme Court seeks response of Centre, States
content: The Supreme Court refused to pass any interim order with regard to the detention, saying any order will have consequences especially with respect to people, who genuinely came from across the borders

title: Give proof, don't use dirty phrases like 'vote chori': EC to Opposition
content: The poll authority said that using “dirty phrases like vote chori” is not only a direct attack on the crores of Indian electors but also an assault on the integrity of lakhs of election staff

title: Savarkar defamation case: Lawyer withdraws plea claiming 'threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: Hours after filing the plea, the lawyer said it was filed without Rahul Gandhi's consent and would be withdrawn

title: Supreme Court asks Kerala to share its names for V-C search panel with the Governor’s counsel
content: Attorney General R. Venkataramani informed the Supreme Court that the Governor has decided on names of top academicians from IITs to be considered for the V-C posts

title: Two women advocates detained for ‘instigating’ conservancy workers’ protest in Chennai
content: Police officials declined to comment, but indicated that the two women advocates may face charges of instigating the conservancy workers’ protest.

title: Kerala Election Commission paving way for voter fraud in local body polls too, alleges Thrissur DCC president
content: Current voter list software does not have option to detect vote duplication, opening doors for large-scale manipulation in local polls, alleges Joseph Tajet

title: Congress leader T.N. Prathapan alleges BJP Central leadership manipulated voters’ list in Thrissur, seeks judicial probe
content: Prathapan alleges BJP’s Central leadership manipulated 2023-24 voters’ list update in Kerala by influencing a private software company engaged by Election Commission of India, enabling last-minute inclusion of over 30,000 fake votes in Thrissur constituency

title: Bihar at a crossroads
content: This e-book from The Hindu with essays from subject experts and journalists traces Bihar’s development trajectory within the context of what promises to be a historic election

title: Meghalaya asks Centre to convince Bangladesh to erect fencing close to International Border
content: "We have taken up with the MHA, urging it to convince the government of Bangladesh, let us go close to the main pillar of the border so that we can avoid fencing outside the village," Deputy CM of Meghalaya Prestone Tynsong said

title: Watch: How many stray dogs are there in India? No one knows
content: We show why India’s dog population figures are so unreliable, how this affects vaccination, sterilisation, and shelter planning, and why counting them right is the first step toward solving the stray dog crisis.

title: Jammu and Kashmir Statehood: Consider ground realities, remember Pahalgam attack, Supreme Court tells petitioners
content: The CJI turned to the petitioners to observe that “you have to take into consideration the ground realities... Remember what happened in Pahalgam”

title: Congress accuses Modi govt of being 'biased' in allocating semiconductor projects
content: Much earlier similar transfer of locations were forced through. Two semiconductor manufacturing projects were compelled to shift their proposed location from Telangana to Gujarat, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Palaniswami, Vijay slam DMK government over detention of protesting conservancy workers in Chennai
content: K. Selvaperunthagai, president of the Tamil Nadu Congress Committee (TNCC), an ally of the DMK, also expressed concern over the manner in which the protesters were evacuated and detained

title: Flag sales down to a quarter in country’s first BIS-recognised national flag manufacturing unit in Karnataka
content: Amendment to flag code, which allows polyester flags, is the main reason cited for sales coming down year after year

title: At the heart of the Bihar SIR dispute is the basic natural justice principle: hear a person before causing harm
content: There are stringent standards and procedures set out by statutory laws to guide the ECI on the registration of names in the electoral rolls. These laws balance out the ECI’s power of superintendence over elections under Article 324 with the ordinary citizens’ or the “little man’s” right to vote enshrined in Article 326 of the Constitution and Section 62 of the Representation of the People (RP) Act

title: Nine including seven militants arrested in Manipur
content: “A joint team of Manipur Police and Assam Rifles arrested one active member of the banned Kangleipak Communist Party involved in extortion activity,” the police said

title: Man beaten to death by ten persons, four held; police probing various angles
content: Police suspect an old enmity led to the murder of Suleiman Khan, who was preparing for the police recruitment exam

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Supreme Court cancels bail granted to actor Darshan
content: The Bench passed the order while hearing a plea filed by the State Government challenging the High Court’s December 13, 2024 order granting bail to actor Darshan and other co-accused

title: Punjab Police arrests two operatives of Lawrence Bishnoi gang
content: "In a major breakthrough, Anti Gangster Task Force (#AGTF) Punjab, arrests two most-wanted Lawrence Bishnoi gang operatives from #Patiala-#Ambala Highway near Village Shambhu," says DGP Gaurav Yadav on X

title: Equity markets climb in early trade on buying in HDFC Bank, TCS
content: Extending its previous day’s rally, the 30-share BSE Sensex climbed 154.07 points to 80,693.98 in early trade. The 50-share NSE Nifty went up by 45 points to 24,664.35

title: Amit Shah pays tributes to those who suffered during Partition, says Congress divided nation
content: On Partition Horrors Remembrance Day, Amit Shah said it is an occasion to express condolences by remembering the pain of those who suffered due to the Partition of the country.

title: Rajinikanth’s Coolie draws frenzy in Kerala’s Ernakulam with 350 houseful shows across 30-plus screens
content: Coolie has an added draw for Kerala audiences, with Malayalam actor Soubin Shahir’s dance in the song ‘Monica...’ going viral ahead of its release

title: Case filed against Shilpa Shetty, Raj Kundra for alleged ₹60 crore fraud
content: According to Mr. Kothari, in 2015, Ms. Shetty and Mr. Kundra approached him through a mediator seeking a ₹75 crore loan for their company, Best Deal TV Pvt Ltd, which promoted lifestyle products and ran an online shopping platform.

title: Bihar SIR row hearing LIVE: SC directs ECI to publish list of deleted voters and reason for deletion
content: Supreme Court, in its interim order, ordered the poll body to publish the enumerated list at district level by August 19, 5 pm

title: Two-day international conference on AI and machine learning at Vijayanagara Sri Krishnadevaraya University in Ballari
content: University Registrar C. Nagaraju observed that while humans invent technology, machines are now evolving to control humans

title: Chennai conservancy workers’ protest LIVE: Stalin says no compromise on dignity of workers as Opposition slams DMK govt. for midnight detention
content: Around 600 protesters, including advocates and members of the Communist parties, were removed from the pavement near the Ripon Building, the seat of Greater Chennai Corporation in the intervening night of August 13 and 14, 2025

title: Fire at cafe located in residential building in Thane; 35 persons evacuated
content: The blaze erupted in the Parsik Cafe located on the ground floor of the six-storey building at Kharegaon in Kalwa (West)

title: Jagan in touch with Congress for a pact, alleges TDP
content: TDP said Jagan was sending former Minister and his close confidant Botcha Satyanarayana regularly to New Delhi to meet Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and discuss arrangements for a formal tie up

title: Stray dogs row hearing in Supreme Court highlights: Order reserved on plea to stay directive for rounding up strays and placing them in shelters
content: Amid widespread outrage over its earlier directive, the Supreme Court has decided to place the matter before a larger Bench

title: Karnataka govt. to set up one delimitation commission for all five corporations
content: Deputy Chief Minister and Bengaluru Development Minister D.K. Shivakumar recently said that the final notification of the five corporations will be issued on September 2 and delimitation will begin on September 3. The final ward list will be notified by November 30

title: 3.1 magnitude quake wakes up Qutbullapur near Vikarabad
content: According to media reports, Rangapur, Barlapalli, and Nayamath Nagar were some of the villages where residents said they felt the tremors

title: Dating app investment scam: Man loses ₹13.3 lakh
content: The victim first invested ₹50,000 via IMPS, received a small profit, and successfully withdrew the amount, which built his trust in the platform. Over time, he deposited ₹8,00,000

title: Delhi court acquits Swati Maliwal accused of revealing rape victim's name
content: According to the FIR, the notice sent by Ms. Maliwal as the chairperson of DCW, in which she sought to know about the investigation in the rape case, was "intentionally circulated" on a WhatsApp group and shown by a TV channel.

title:
India monsoon rains LIVE: 
Massive cloudburst in Jammu & Kashmir’s Kishtwar, at least 12 killed
content: The disaster hit Chasoti, the last motorable village on the way to the Machail Mata temple, between 12 noon and 1 p.m. when a large number of people had gathered for the Machail Mata yatra.

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Ambadas Danve calls rice for children sent to Africa a scam
content: Mr. Danve challenged the government to have an open discussion on the issue, naming J.V. Grains Dealers, the social organisation involved in the alleged corruption

title: Deaf-mute woman gang-raped in U.P.; two accused arrested after encounter
content: In the 16-second viral video, the woman, seemingly barefoot, is seen being chased down a dimly lit deserted road by men on motorcycles

title: Chennai, the chosen land of superstar Rajinikanth
content: As the superstar, who has seen 74 summers, turns 50 in his celluloid career, it is time for Chennai and the rest of the world to welcome his latest action flick, ‘Coolie’, set to release in theatres today (August 14, 2025).

title: Pregnant woman carried through waist-deep water by family to cross swollen stream
content: The local police helped them cross the stream safely and shifted her to the government hospital in the mandal headquarters in an ambulance.

title: JE vaccination in seven more districts, more than 27 lakh children to be covered with a single dose
content: Focused vaccination campaigns will be held at government and government-aided schools, anganwadi centres, orphanages and juvenile homes.

title: Access to non-farm business, irrigation significantly reduces climate change-induced rural migration, says IIT Madras study
content: The IDHS study is a nationally representative, multi-topic panel survey of thousands of households in urban and rural areas across the country.

title: AIADMK govt. never hiked power tariff despite joining UDAY scheme: EPS
content: Palaniswami said his government joined the Central scheme only after the conditions set by Tamil Nadu were accepted; he also blamed the DMK government for consistently increasing the tariff

title: Reservoirs in Andhra Pradesh are 78% full
content: While the total gross capacity at Full Reservoir Level is 1,000.07 tmc ft, the storage now stands at 782.40 tmc ft, up from 672.93 tmc ft the same day the previous year

title: Four sworn-in permanent judges of Andhra Pradesh High Court
content: Harinath Nunepally, Kiranmayee Mandava, Sumathi Jagadam, and Nyapathy Vijay have earlier been additional judges of the High Court

title: Gujarat to get new veterinary college; admissions to start next month

title: Primary school teachers in Karnataka to boycott classes, go on an indefinite strike from September 3

title: Thousands of forest rights titles go missing in Chhattisgarh records, officials claim ‘reporting error’

content: Lionel Taylor, an original Denver Bronco and a member of the team's Ring of Fame, has died at age 89.
